definition: to charge or entreat earnestly or solemnly
examples: "I conjure you … to weigh my case well … "

definition: to summon by or as if by invocation or incantation
to affect or effect by or as if by magic, imagine, contrive, to bring to mind
examples: We conjure up our own metaphors for our own needs …
conjured up a clever plan to raise the money

definition: to summon a devil or spirit by invocation or incantation

examples: … prayed and conjured, but all was useless …

definition: to use a conjurer's tricks : juggle
to treat or regard as important
examples: Victor Hugo is a name to conjure with …
